alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 5:26PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Aroostook County through 545 PM EDT... At 526 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mars Hill to 6 miles west of Bridgewater. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mars Hill, Easton, Bridgewater, Monticello, Blaine, Westfield and Number Nine Mountain. This includes US Highway 1 between Bridgewater and Mars Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern Maine.
